messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:41): implemented new-style <nobr>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:42): It seems end tag handling of some elements has also changed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:43): most notably "/body" and "/head"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:51): Hmph, now I have enough tests that Safari won't run them all simultaneously without dropping the last couple of dozen and randomly crashing :-(
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:52): that's good :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:53): have you filed bugs on them already?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:53): (I implemented new-style <link>, <meta>, <base> in html5lib)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:53): jgraham, you need to fix the encoding sniffer for comment handling
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (16:56): found a bug in the html serializer: <p>a&lt;b&gt;c</p>  =>  <p>a<b>c</p>; but only if a character encoding is specified.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:57): does the html serializer implement the innerHTML algorithm?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:57): Looks like it's actually an intentional limit in WebKit - it won't display more than 200 iframes on a page
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:57): I honestly haven't followed all these treewalker, etc. additions
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (16:57): don't see 'inner' anywhere in the serializer.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:00): maybe t.broyer should be invited on IRC...
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:04): Hmm, can't do more than 200 of <object> either
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:04): maybe 200 object + 200 iframe? :)
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:05): Philip: perhaps you should get another browser?  :-P
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:05): I wonder what the rationale is for this change: http://html5.org/tools/web-apps-tracker?from=917&to=918
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:05): Seems to be limit of 200 on num_object+num_iframe
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:06): a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d: Unfortunately I can't use another browser to run test cases in Safari :-(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:08): Ooh, it even works fine in IE6
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:08): (except for failing pretty much all of the test cases, obviously)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:13): you know what, I'll just implement the above change and see what happens
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:17): Also, I can't even do >200 iframes by having 16 iframes each containing 16 iframes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:18): that's what I was afraid of
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:18): no testcase breaks
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:19): see the link above
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:19): http://html5.org/tools/web-apps-tracker?from=917&to=918
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:20): http://trac.webkit.org/projects/webkit/browser/trunk/WebCore/html/HTMLFrameElementBase.cpp#L72
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:21): supposes he just has to do fewer tests at a time
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:23): wow, sites rely on self-references
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:23): I suppose the aforementioned change affects whitespace handling
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:32): the change also affects handling of </body><meta> for instance
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:33): I'm not sure this was a good change
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:35): mailed the list
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:40): changing how </p> works breaks quite a lot of tests
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:49): I left that change out for now

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:51): Aha, it works (about half the time, randomly) in Safari if I add a button which deletes all the iframes for completed tests and then recreates the iframes for tests that haven't loaded yet, and if I then change the text size up and down so it redraws the screen properly
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:51): ...which is a totally horrible hack, but then I already need another hack to replace <iframe> with <object> so that it stops being invisible in Safari
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:52): (though it only does that after it's finished loading the iframes, because it looks like onload doesn't run on objects)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:52): why do you recreate the iframes?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:52): just set frame.location ...

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:56): That doesn't appear to work (is location only set after it's decided it's acceptable to load that iframe?), but it looks like setAttribute('src', getAttribute('src')) does it, so that's a bit nicer

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:57): should probably just split the test-report-generating page into several pages of ~100 tests, and do something cleverer on the server side to merge all the results
